qas.question: What is the driving force behind voluntary green electricity within the EU?
What states that EU Member States must ensure that the origin of electricity produced from renewables can be guaranteed?
In the US, what is the main tool to track and stimulate voluntary actions?
What is the driving force behind voluntary green electricity outside of the EU?
What isn't the driving force behind voluntary green electricity within the EU?
What states that EU Member States must not ensure that the origin of electricity produced from renewables can be guaranteed?
n the US, what is not the main tool to track and stimulate voluntary actions?

context: The driving force behind voluntary green electricity within the EU are the <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>liberalized electricity markets<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> and the <a1_0><b5_0>RES Directive<b5_0/><a1_0/>. According to the directive the EU Member States must ensure that the origin of electricity produced from renewables can be guaranteed and therefore a "guarantee of origin" must be issued (article 15). Environmental organisations are using the voluntary market to create new renewables and improving sustainability of the existing power production. In the US the main tool to track and stimulate voluntary actions is <a2_0><b6_0>Green-e program<b6_0/><a2_0/> managed by Center for Resource Solutions. In Europe the main voluntary tool used by the NGOs to promote sustainable electricity production is EKOenergy label.
